Job Title: Co-op - Mechanical Engineering

Location: Lafayette, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Landis+Gyr is a leading global provider of integrated energy management solutions. We measure and analyze energy utilization to generate empowering analytics for smart grid and infrastructure management, enabling utilities and consumers to reduce energy consumption. Our innovative and proven portfolio of software, services and intelligent sensor technology is a key driver to decarbonize the grid. Having avoided more than 9 million tons of CO2 in FY 2021 and committed to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, Landis+Gyr manages energy better – since 1896.

With sales of USD 1.5 billion in FY 2021, Landis+Gyr employs around 6,500 talented people across five continents.

Welcome to Landis+Gyr! We're at the forefront of the energy industry revolution - let's build a brighter energy future together!

The Landis+Gyr Co-op program is designed to enhance the quality and scope of learning by providing students with the option of integrating academic study with related, work-based learning. This position begins August 2024. Applicants must be enrolled in the undergraduate program and available for an alternating rotating 3-semester schedule so expected graduation date should be 2026/2027 to have enough time to work 3 semesters rotating with school semesters. This is a fulltime position working approximately 40 hours Monday through Friday on-site at our Lafayette, Indiana location. Co-ops are paid positions but we don’t offer a housing stipend or housing assistance so candidates local to our Lafayette, Indiana location are preferred.

Project Overview

 Perform mechanical system and component design utilizing solid modeling CAD tools under the guidance of the Project Engineer or Supervisor Create detailed drawings of parts and assemblies utilizing CAD tools Calculate and lay out dimensions, angles, curvature of parts, materials to be used, and relationship of various parts to entire structure Generate BOMs and ECOs Interact with suppliers to procure, deliver and implement parts and designs

Objectives/Responsibilities

 Candidate is interested in mechanical engineering product design and processes Pursuit of a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from an accredited university Interested in completing multiple work terms; work terms alternate with school semesters Have completed or working towards completing an engineering graphics CAD class Experience in Windows applications including Microsoft Office Good written and verbal communication skills Ability to provide thorough attention to detail

Education/Experience

Undergraduate student seeking a Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

If you have the drive and enthusiasm to accept this challenge and to work in a very dynamic, cross functional and international environment, we are looking forward to meeting you. Click apply now.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
